titleStmt.title: A summons for sleepers Wherein most grieuous and notorious offenders are cited to bring forth true frutes of repentance, before the day of the Lord now at hand. Hereunto is annexed, a patterne for pastors, deciphering briefly the dueties pertaining to that function, by Leonard Wright.
titleStmt.author: Wright, Leonard, b. 1555 or 6.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A15765 of text S121115 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 26034.3). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 151 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 32 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Wolfe, sold by Edward Aggas],

notesStmt.note: Copies matched to this record have the following characteristics and variants. B1r first line has "vsury"; last line begins (1) "they be" or (2) "they he". C3r line 7 from bottom begins "wise men". E1v lines 4,5 have (1) "praising .. brute" or (2) "praysing .. bruit". F2r has subheading "A prayer.".
Quire pi is in the same setting as STC 26034 and 26034.7.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

keywords.term: Pastoral theology -- Church of England -- Early works to 1800.
